benchmark_details.name: GLBench
benchmark_details.overview: GLBench is the first comprehensive benchmark for evaluating GraphLLM methods in both supervised and zero-shot scenarios, enabling fair comparisons among different categories of GraphLLM methods and traditional graph neural networks.
benchmark_details.data_type: node classification tasks with text attributes

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a unified evaluation framework for GraphLLM methods and support comparative analysis across different methods and datasets.

data.source: Publicly available datasets covering text-attributed graphs across multiple domains.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on model predictions against ground truth labels for various classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and Macro-F1 scores indicate better performance in predicting node classifications.
methodology.validation: Consistency in data processing and experimental settings across multiple datasets for fair evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Datasets are under the MIT License unless otherwise specified.
